description: During the Development Phase, the system is constructed according to the detailed design specifications established in the Design Phase.
This phase includes coding, configuration, integration, and testing of the system components to ensure that the system satisfies the approved requirements.
All system elements—software, hardware, databases, and procedures—are developed, configured, and integrated into a complete system.
At the conclusion of this phase, the system will be ready for formal testing activities.

responsibilities.Business Owner: Reviews development progress and validates that the system will satisfy business requirements.
responsibilities.Project Manager: Responsible for managing development activities, ensuring deliverables are completed, and leading the Integrated Project Team.
responsibilities.Integrated Project Team: Executes the development tasks, performs code reviews, integration, and documentation updates.

Critical Partners.Enterprise Architecture: Ensures compliance with enterprise standards and Technical Reference Model during development.
Critical Partners.Security: Confirms security requirements are implemented and security testing is included in the Test Plan.
Critical Partners.Acquisition: Validates that products and services are procured and received according to contract terms.
Critical Partners.Budget: Monitors development costs against the project baseline and mitigates variances.
Critical Partners.Finance: Verifies that financial tracking aligns with expenditures and approved funding.
Critical Partners.HR: Ensures development team staffing levels are sufficient and competencies are maintained.
Critical Partners.Section 508: Confirms accessibility requirements are implemented and test cases documented.
Critical Partners.CPIC: Ensures ongoing cost and schedule reporting align with investment controls.
Critical Partners.Performance: Confirms the system meets technical performance measures and supports integration readiness.
Critical Partners.Records Management: Ensures records management requirements are addressed in development artifacts.

activities: Develop and configure system components (software, hardware, databases).
Perform coding according to approved design specifications.
Conduct peer code reviews and implement corrective actions.
Integrate modules and components, ensuring interoperability and compliance with architecture standards.
Conduct unit, module, and integration testing to verify functional accuracy.
Update the Test Plan to reflect changes identified during development and integration.
Perform data conversion and migration preparation activities.
Develop and finalize Operations & Maintenance (O&M) Manual, Security Plan, Risk Assessment, and Training Plan.
Prepare User Manuals and Technical Documentation.
Conduct configuration management and version control for all developed components.
Implement approved change requests and document configuration updates.
Prepare for formal system testing and Operational Readiness Review.
deliverables: Fully Developed Business Product (System Code, Configurations, and Components).

exit_criteria.objective: To determine whether the developed system is complete, integrated, and ready for formal testing activities.
phase_specific: The Business Product is fully developed and unit tested.
All required deliverables and supporting documentation are completed.
Integration testing demonstrates that the system components function together properly.
generic: Development documentation is baselined and approved.
All variances from baselines (cost, schedule, scope) are reviewed and resolved.
Stage Gate Review successfully completed and approval to proceed to Implementation Phase received.

project_review: The Development Review ensures that all system components have been developed and integrated according to the approved design.
Confirms that the system is ready for formal testing and that supporting documentation is complete.
Includes verification that all security and performance requirements have been implemented.

stage_gate_review.title: Development Stage Gate Review
stage_gate_review.purpose: To assess readiness to transition to the Implementation Phase.
focus: Completion of development and integration activities.
Verification that the system meets defined requirements and has been tested successfully at the integration level.
Approval of all deliverables and confirmation of readiness for operational testing.
